bbc.title: Norway's PM agrees crown princess had 'poor judgement' over Epstein links
bbc.description: Jonas Gahr Støre says he agreed with Princess Mette-Marit's own remarks over her contacts with the late sex offender.

bbc.title: Epstein sent $75,000 to accounts linked to Mandelson, files suggest
bbc.description: Lord Mandelson says he has no record or recollection of receiving the sums and does not know if the documents are authentic.

bbc.title: 'Do you think you're the devil himself?' Epstein questioned in newly released interview
bbc.description: The footage, which is part of millions of files released by the US Department of Justice, shows the late sex offender being questioned by an unnamed interviewer.

bbc.title: KPop Demon Hunters make history as Grammys get under way
bbc.description: The Cure, Yungblud and FKA Twigs are the first British winners on the night in Los Angeles.

bbc.title: Twelve miners killed by Russian strike in Ukraine, officials say
bbc.description: Fifteen others were reported injured in the strike near a bus carrying the workers on Sunday.

bbc.title: Iranian protester Erfan Soltani released on bail, reports say
bbc.description: Reports in January had said he was due to be executed after his arrest in connection with anti-government protests.

bbc.title: Boy, 5, and father detained by ICE return to Minnesota after release
bbc.description: The boy was released on the order of a judge who said his detention was "cruel" and "bereft of human decency”.

bbc.title: Iran's supreme leader warns of regional war if US attacks
bbc.description: Trump earlier said Iran - which is due to begin a live-fire naval exercise in a key shipping route - was in "serious discussions".

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Leading China Property Developer Reports Huge loss, in Sign of Widening Real-Estate Woes
wsj.description: Troubles at Vanke raise questions about the continued spread of the property crisis and whether the Chinese state will step in.

wsj.title: Freed Israeli Hostages Still Had Shrapnel in Their Bodies From Oct. 7 Attack
wsj.description: Some of the women were held alone for extended periods and spent eight months in tunnels, an Israeli medical official said.

wsj.title: Suspected Sabotage of Deep-Sea Cable Triggers First NATO-Led Response
wsj.description: The alliance mounted its first coordinated response to a suspected sabotage campaign against critical infrastructure after another cable was severed in the Baltic Sea.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Italy Supports Saudi Arabia Joining Fighter-Jet Program, PM Meloni Says
wsj.description: The U.K., Italy and Japan have already partnered on the Global Combat Air Programme, which aims to put a new stealth fighter with supersonic capability in the skies by 2035.

wsj.title: Shippers Wary of Red Sea Routes Despite Houthi Pledge to End Targeting
wsj.description: The world’s top three container operators said they fear instability in Gaza and broader regional tensions mean continued danger.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
wsj.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

wsj.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
wsj.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

wsj.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
wsj.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

wsj.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
wsj.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

wsj.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

wsj.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
wsj.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

wsj.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
wsj.description: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

bloomberg.title: Hang Seng Launches HK's First Physical Gold ETF
bloomberg.description: Hang Seng Investment Management has launched a new gold ETF in Hong Kong as demand for the metal soars. The company's Director and CEO Rosita Lee discusses the rationale and outlook on Bloomberg's The

bloomberg.title: India’s Budget Disappoints With Surprise Tax Hike, Investors Say
bloomberg.description: The Indian government’s budget proposal to increase taxes on equity derivatives trading without providing measures to immediately stem foreign outflows is set to pressure domestic shares in the near-t

bloomberg.title: Stocks Trim Early Loss, Precious Metals Recover: Markets Wrap
bloomberg.description: Stocks trimmed their losses at the open and precious metals recovered from a weak start, underscoring the fragile sentiment in markets after a choppy end to the week on Wall Street.

bloomberg.title: Lasertec Shares Drop After Outlook Misses Market Expectations
bloomberg.description: Lasertec Corp.’s stock price plunged 10% after the company raised its outlook less than investors had anticipated in the face of an AI-related surge in spending.

bloomberg.title: Foreign Investors Dumped Indonesia Sovereign Debt as Stocks Slid
bloomberg.description: Indonesia’s stock-market rout spilled into sovereign bonds last week as foreign investors dumped debt alongside equities.

bloomberg.title: Yen Drops After Takaichi Comment Cools Intervention Speculation
bloomberg.description: The yen slid after Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said a weak currency can be a major opportunity for export industries, cooling speculation that her government is poised to intervene to suppo

bloomberg.title: Gold Extends Biggest Fall in Over a Decade as Rally Snaps Back
bloomberg.description: Gold fell, extending its biggest plunge in more than a decade, as precious metals snapped back from a record-breaking rally that had run too far, too fast. Silver also slumped.

bloomberg.title: How China Uses a ‘National Team’ to Influence Trading
bloomberg.description: China’s stock market has long been more volatile than Beijing would like, a problem that has taken on greater urgency as the government tries to shift growth away from property and debt and toward tec

bloomberg.title: Ro Khanna Pushes California Billionaires, Union to Compromise on Wealth Tax Plan
bloomberg.description: Tech industry and labor leaders plan to meet in March as Representative Ro Khanna pushes for a compromise deal over a proposed billionaire tax that has rattled Silicon Valley, a person familiar with t

bloomberg.title: UK Ex-Ambassador Mandelson Quits Labour Party in Epstein Fallout
bloomberg.description: Peter Mandelson, Britain’s former ambassador to the US, resigned from the UK’s ruling Labour Party to avoid causing it “further embarrassment” after the latest revelations about his links to the disgr

bloomberg.title: Vote Count Starts in Costa Rican Election Dominated by Crime
bloomberg.description: Ballots are being counted in Costa Rica in an election dominated by soaring drug violence that has shocked a country historically known as a peaceful tourist haven in a turbulent region.

bloomberg.title: Trump Says He’ll Close Kennedy Center for Two Years in July
bloomberg.description: President Donald Trump said he plans to close the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts for about two years to carry out renovations after his takeover prompted a significant backlash.

bloomberg.title: Argentina Bought $808 Million from US to Pay IMF, La Nacion Says
bloomberg.description: Argentina bought $808 million in special drawing rights from the US Treasury to confront its latest interest payments at the International Monetary Fund without tapping a swap line shared between both

bloomberg.title: How Thailand’s Election Will Test Old Guard’s Grip on Power
bloomberg.description: Thailand’s Feb. 8 election will test whether the country can break the cycle of more than a decade of political instability. This upheaval has seen a series of short-lived governments ousted by both t

bloomberg.title: Texas stunner: Democrat Taylor Rehmet flips Republican state Senate district Trump won by 17 points
bloomberg.description: Democrat Taylor Rehmet flipped a reliably Republican state Senate district in Texas in Saturday's special election, continuing a string of surprise victories for Democrats across the U.S. in the year

bloomberg.description: For much of the time that President Donald Trump was mulling his potential choice for the next chair of the Federal Reserve, the debate in markets swirled around whether his pick would lower interest

aljazeera.title: Five-year-old boy and father detained by ICE return home to Minnesota
aljazeera.description: Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, Adrian, were accompanied home by Texas Democratic Representative Joaquin Castro.

aljazeera.title: Israel partially reopens Rafah crossing between Egypt and Gaza in pilot
aljazeera.description: The pilot comes before Gaza residents begin to pass through the crossing on Monday, Israeli authorities say.

aljazeera.title: How will Pakistan deal with the unrest in Balochistan?
aljazeera.description: The most recent coordinated attacks by separatists in the southwestern province have killed dozens of people.

aljazeera.title: Epstein email reveals plan to access Libya’s frozen state assets
aljazeera.description: Email sent to Jeffrey Epstein in 2011 outlines what the sender described as financial and legal opportunities in Libya.

aljazeera.title: Gaza patients in limbo amid Israel’s ‘pilot reopening’ of Rafah crossing
aljazeera.description: The Rafah crossing’s pilot opening begins amid confusion as Gaza’s patients face unclear criteria, limited travel slots.

aljazeera.title: Gaza’s daily nightmare vs US talk of AI-driven smart cities
aljazeera.description: Why are Gazans living in misery, with daily Israeli bombings, as the US promises ‘peace, stability and opportunity’?

aljazeera.title: Death toll from Swiss New Year Alpine bar fire increases to 41
aljazeera.description: The latest victim succumbing to injuries was an 18-year-old Swiss national.

aljazeera.title: Russian drone attack on bus in Ukraine kills at least 12
aljazeera.description: Russian drone strike kills 12 mine workers in Ukraine's Dnipropetrovsk region, injuring seven others.

washpost.title: Russia strikes Ukrainian energy sector after Trump push for pause
washpost.description: A Russian attack on coal mining facilities in Ukraine Sunday killed at least 12 miners, according to DTEK, the country’s largest private energy company.

washpost.title: Iran’s missiles pose deadly threat, gulf allies warn, as Trump weighs strikes
washpost.description: Even after a 12-day war with Israel, Iran retains the arsenal to hit U.S. allies and bases. U.S. strikes would lead to “regional war,” Iran’s supreme leader said.

washpost.title: Israeli airstrikes kill 32 in Gaza, Palestinian officials say
washpost.description: Israel said it targeted Hamas militants and weapons sites. The majority of the dead were women and children, the Gaza Health Ministry said.

washpost.title: Epstein file photos appear to show Andrew crouched over female on floor
washpost.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, who was stripped of his royal titles over ties to Jeffrey Epstein, seems to be in images released by the Justice Department.

washpost.title: China’s efforts to boost the birth rate have failed. Is coercion next?
washpost.description: China's birth rate has fallen to a record low, prompting concerns about the country's demographic future and the potential for more coercive measures.

washpost.title: U.S. approves almost $16 billion in arms sales to Israel and Saudi Arabia
washpost.description: The sales to Israel, worth close to $6.7 billion, include 30 Apache attack helicopters. Saudi Arabia is set to buy Patriot missiles worth $9 billion.
